Become a Member! - Carnegie Museums of Pittsburgh Membership / Become a Member! Only members enjoy unlimited free admission to four unique world-class museums, in addition to special discounts, exclusive event invitations, and more, all while supporting our community’s access to the four Carnegie Museums. All members enjoy: Free general admission to Carnegie Museum of Art, Carnegie Museum of Natural History, Kamin Science Center, and The Andy Warhol Museum Invitations to members-only events and programming Free reciprocal admission at 300+ ASTC museums and science centers Discounts on classes, camps, educational films at Rangos Giant Cinema, touring exhibitions, laser shows, lectures, and special events A 10% discount in museum stores and cafes (20% store discount during Member Shopping Days) Free Carnegie Kid’s Club card, valid for one prize/month at the museum stores Free subscription to Carnegie magazine Membership Levels Senior Membership $55/$4.58 monthly 1 named individual (age 65+) Join or Renew Individual Membership $75/$6.25 monthly 1 named individual Join or Renew Dual Membership $105/$8.75 monthly 2 adults OR 1 adult + 1 child Free reciprocal admission at an additional 275+ ROAM museums and arboretums Join or Renew Family Membership $160/$13.33 monthly 2 adults + 4 children Free reciprocal admission at an additional 275+ ROAM museums and arboretums Join or Renew Premium Membership $275/$22.90 monthly 2 adults + 8 guests Free reciprocal admission at an additional 275+ ROAM museums and arboretums, plus 20+ major art and natural history museums 10 half-off coupons for educational films at Rangos Giant Cinema Join or Renew Teen Membership Free for teens 13–18 years old 1 named individual (age 13–18) who is a PA resident Free admission to the four Carnegie Museums Invitations to teen-only events Learn More Carnegie Connectors A new membership for young professionals, ages 21 to 40, who have a drive to create a community based on shared interests in art, science, and natural history. Plan a Visit - Carnegie Museums of Pittsburgh Our Museums / Plan a Visit Carnegie Museums of Art and Natural History ADDRESS: 4400 Forbes Avenue Pittsburgh, PA 15213 412.622.3131 HOURS: Mon., Wed., Fri.-Sun.: 10 a.m.– 5 p.m. Thurs.: 10 a.m.–8 p.m. Closed Tuesdays HOLIDAYS/CLOSINGS: The museums are closed on Easter, Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Year’s Day. ADMISSION: Plan your next visit with timed ticketing . Adults: $25 Seniors (65+): $20 Students with ID/Children age 3–18: $15 Members/Children 2 and under: Free Weekdays after 3 p.m .: Half-price admission SPECIAL OFFERS: See discounts and offers for active U.S. Military, students, teachers, and more. PARKING: Our parking garage is located just behind the museum. Parking at the museums is now based on hourly rates , and guests will pull a ticket from the parking machines upon entry. Upon exiting, guests will have the option to pay with mobile pay via a QR code on ticket, at one of two pay stations , or at the exit gate . Cash is not an accepted form of payment for parking. See our parking rates We offer designated accessible spaces in the garage for visitors with disabilities. The clearance is six feet, eight inches. If you need alternate arrangements in advance for oversized vehicles, please call us at 412.622.3131 , 9 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday through Friday. DINING: Café Carnegie is open for on-site dining or for takeout on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Friday, Saturday, and Sunday from 11 a.m.-3 p.m., Thursday 11 a.m. to 3 p.m., 5 p.m. to 8 p.m. and the Coffee and Wine Bar is open Monday, Tuesday Wednesday, Friday, Saturday, and Sunday from 9a.m.-5 p.m., Thursday 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. Fossil Fuels is open Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday 8 a.m. to 4 p.m., Tuesday 8 a.m. to 2 p.m., Saturday, Sunday 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. ACCESSIBILITY: The museums are continually working to make programs and exhibitions accessible to all visitors . Carnegie Museum of Art - Carnegie Museums of Pittsburgh Our Museums / Carnegie Museum of Art Pittsburgh’s home for great art. And home to the Carnegie International. Carnegie Museum of Art creates experiences that connect people to art, ideas, and one another. It opened in 1895 as the nation’s first museum dedicated to collecting the art of its times. Since 1896, the Carnegie International has been the museum’s most significant exhibition as well as its leading contribution to the field. With each International, the museum writes another chapter in its history. Carnegie Museum of Natural History - Carnegie Museums of Pittsburgh Our Museums / Carnegie Museum of Natural History Exploring the natural world, past and present, through historic collections and wonder-filled galleries. Carnegie Museum of Natural History is a place of world-class scientific inquiry and daily discovery. By displaying nature’s wonders, its galleries and collections spark conversation about the inherent worth of nature and inspire a new generation of scientists and citizen scientists to conserve the planet and its many wonders. Kamin Science Center - Carnegie Museums of Pittsburgh Our Museums / Kamin Science Center Igniting curiosity and sparking a passion for lifelong learning. Pittsburgh’s most-visited museum, the Daniel G. and Carole L. Kamin Science Center inspires visitors of all ages through hands-on exhibits, immersive planetarium shows, live demonstrations, and STEM programs. From hands-on exhibits and the iconic Miniature Railroad & Village ® to the USS Requin (SS 481) submarine and out-of-this-world shows in the Buhl Planetarium, there’s something for everyone to enjoy. The Andy Warhol Museum - Carnegie Museums of Pittsburgh Our Museums / The Andy Warhol Museum Telling Andy Warhol’s story and exploring his legacy. Located in the place of Andy Warhol’s birth, The Andy Warhol Museum illuminates the art, life, and times of one of the most influential American artists of the 20th century. With the largest collection of Warhol’s artworks and archival materials, it’s one of the most comprehensive single-artist museums in the world and the largest in North America. Young Professionals Membership - Carnegie Museums of Pittsburgh Membership / Young Professionals Membership Photo by Elisa Cevallos The Carnegie Connectors membership is geared toward young supporters of Carnegie Museums. Members of this group, suggested for ages 21 to 40, are rising leaders who recognize the importance of investing through their membership in the four Carnegie Museums and the region. Carnegie Connectors demonstrate an interest in arts, science, and natural history, and a drive to create a community based on their shared interests. As a Carnegie Connectors member, you’ll explore and experience what makes all four Carnegie Museums world-class destinations and enjoy programs created with you in mind. Senior Membership - Carnegie Museums of Pittsburgh Membership / Senior Membership The adventure continues at Carnegie Museums for those aged 65 and over! Seniors save year-round on individual membership to the four Carnegie Museums and enjoy special benefits including invitations to Senior Socials, free year-round admission to four world-class museums, and discounts in our museum shops and cafés. All senior members enjoy: Free general admission for one named individual (age 65+) for one year to Carnegie Museum of Art, Carnegie Museum of Natural History, Kamin Science Center, and The Andy Warhol Museum Invitations to events and programming designed just for teen members Free reciprocal admission at 300+ ASTC museums and science centers Discounts on classes, camps, educational films at Rangos Giant Cinema, touring exhibitions, laser shows, lectures, and special events A 10% discount in museum stores and cafés (20% store discount during Member Shopping Days) Free subscription to Carnegie magazine Join or Renew If you’d like to join or renew at a higher level of membership , we offer seniors (65+) a special senior discount on Premium, Family, and Dual memberships . Please call the membership office at 412.622.3314 with any questions. For individuals and families whose barrier to accessing our museums is primarily a financial one, our $20 Family Access Membership helps remove that barrier. Four Museums. One Membership. From youth artmaking to teen science challenges, the four Carnegie Museums provide so many creative ways for teens to connect with each other and their world—and, most importantly, to find their own voice. Teen members enjoy:* Free general admission to Carnegie Museum of Art, Carnegie Museum of Natural History, Kamin Science Center, and The Andy Warhol Museum until the teen’s 19th birthday Invitations to events and programming designed just for teen members Free reciprocal admission at 300+ ASTC museums and science centers Discounts on classes, camps, educational films at Rangos Giant Cinema, touring exhibitions, laser shows, lectures, and special events A 10% discount in museum stores and cafés (20% store discount during Member Shopping Days) Join online today Or, print and complete the Teen Membership Application and return it to any of the four Carnegie Museums or mail to: Carnegie Museums ATTN: Membership 4400 Forbes Avenue Pittsburgh, PA 15213 Teen Events View all events | View all teen events Teen Night: Bubbles and Broomsticks Carnegie Museum of Natural History Thu., Oct 9, 2025 5-8 pm For Members More teen events coming soon New events throughout the year Teen Membership is generously supported by The Grable Foundation . Membership FAQ - Carnegie Museums of Pittsburgh Membership Benefits What are my membership benefits? For a list of membership benefits, visit this web page: Membership benefits For higher level membership benefits visit: Donors Circle , Patrons Circle , or Carnegie Connectors What member events are offered? Members enjoy exhibition previews, exclusive tours, lectures, and more! Please visit our member events page Do members receive reciprocal benefits at other museums? Yes! All member levels enjoy reciprocal admission at museums and science centers that participate in the Association of Science-Technology Centers (ASTC) Passport Program . Participating science centers and museums must be beyond a 90-mile radius of Pittsburgh and your home address. Dual-level members and above enjoy free admission through the Reciprocal Organization of Associated Museums (ROAM) . Note: Reciprocal ROAM museums must be at least 25 miles outside of Pittsburgh. Premium, Donors Circle, and Patrons Circle members also receive reciprocal admission to 20+ select art and natural history museums across the country. Show your Carnegie Museums membership card and a photo ID at admissions. We recommend calling before you visit, as the list of reciprocal museums may change without notice. Using your benefits When can I start using the membership? Immediately! Join at the admissions desk located at our three museum locations and receive a temporary membership card to use immediately. Join online and you will receive a confirmation email to present at the museum for admission. Be sure to type your email address correctly and check, “Yes, I would like to receive communications.” (Still not seeing it? Check your promotions tab or junk folder.) Purchase your membership over the phone, and we will send you a confirmation email at your request. Note that membership purchases made via mail will not be made immediately available. Can I bring guests with my membership? Visit our member page to see how many guests are included with your membership. Note: You can bring guests to member events just like you bring guests for a museum visit. If your membership does not allow for guests and you would like to bring more people, you can upgrade to a higher level by calling 412.622.3314. Can my adult children or other relatives use my membership? Our membership levels cover people, not households. If you would like another family member to use your membership, please list them as one of the designated adults, or upgrade to a higher level by calling 412.622.3314. Depending on your membership level , they may accompany you to the museum as a guest. Memberships are not transferable: Adults not accompanied by a cardholder will not be admitted under the membership. Can I use my membership for a group tour, field trip, or 21+ Night? Free membership admission does not apply to group visits, field trips, or special programs such as 21+ Night due to additional programming and expenses related to these visits. Carnegie Connectors can receive discounts on 21+ Nights. Can I visit without my membership card? Designated adults on the membership can

Night? Free membership admission does not apply to group visits, field trips, or special programs such as 21+ Night due to additional programming and expenses related to these visits. Carnegie Connectors can receive discounts on 21+ Nights. Can I visit without my membership card? Designated adults on the membership can visit without their card. Simply show a valid photo ID at the admissions counter. Member children visiting without a designated adult or caregiver MUST present a membership card to gain admission under the membership. How do I apply my member discount in the online store? Use your 10% discount (20% on Member Shopping Days) on unique and fun gifts from all four of our Carnegie Museums stores . To receive your member discount on our online store, just enter code CMPMember in the Coupon box on the cart or checkout page and click Apply. Digital Card What is a “Carnegie Digital Membership Card”? Is it the same as an app? Your optional Carnegie Digital Membership Card is an app that can be accessed on your smartphone. I don’t want a Carnegie Digital Membership Card. What should I do? The Carnegie Digital Membership Card is optional. If you don’t wish to download the card, simply disregard the message and you won’t be offered this feature until you renew your membership. *Please note, monthly memberships will not receive a physical card. If you wish to opt-out of membership emails, but wish to receive a digital card, please submit this form. Will I still receive a physical Carnegie Membership Card? Yes! Unless you select the option to opt-out of a physical card, you will still receive a physical Carnegie Membership Card, whether or not you opt-in to the Carnegie Digital Membership Card. How do I add Carnegie Digital Membership Card to my smartphone? iPhone- Access the email from your smartphone and click the “Download” button, then click “Add to Wallet” and “Add.” The card will automatically go to your iPhone’s Apple Wallet. It can be accessed in Wallet at any time. Android- Make sure the Google Wallet app is installed. If not, you may download it from here . Open the email directly from your phone. Tap on the “Download Membership” button. Click on “add to Google Wallet”. A preview will appear. Click on “Save to Google Wallet”. In some cases, Google Wallet might ask you to log in so you can save it to an account. Please log in to continue (no credit card information should be required). The card will be saved to Google Wallet and you will be able to access it from the Google Wallet app at any moment. We strongly encourage members to use Google Wallet as the primary digital wallet solution for Android, but will continue to help you in case you’d like to use an alternative Android wallet option, like Wallet by Wallet Union.. I downloaded my card but can’t find it. If you have an iPhone, the card will automatically download to Apple Wallet. Check

primary digital wallet solution for Android, but will continue to help you in case you’d like to use an alternative Android wallet option, like Wallet by Wallet Union.. I downloaded my card but can’t find it. If you have an iPhone, the card will automatically download to Apple Wallet. Check the app for your new card (scroll through any cards that are already there–it may be hiding!). If you have an Android, you’ll need to download Wallet Passes from the Play Store prior to downloading the card. How do I access the back of my Carnegie Digital Membership Card? iOS/iPhone 1. Open your Carnegie Digital Membership Card 2. Tap on the three dots at the top right of the card. If you don’t see the dots, make sure you are not accessing the card from your lock screen. Android 1. Open your Carnegie Digital Membership Card 2. Tap on the “i” icon at the bottom right of the card. My family member is also on my membership account. How can they receive the card? iPhone/iOS- Navigate to the back of the card (tap on the “…” button on the front), then tap on the share icon at the top right to send the card to your secondary member. Android- Navigate to the back of the card (tap on the small “i” on the front) and use the “Share Pass” button to send the card to your secondary member. I have not received my Carnegie Digital Membership Card. Please complete this survey and we will resend your Carnegie Digital Membership Card. I don’t have a mobile phone, what should I do? Please contact us at membership@carnegiemuseums.org or 412.622.3314. I have a question about my membership information or benefits. Please contact us at membership@carnegiemuseums.org . Purchasing your membership I have more than four children. Which membership level should I purchase? Memberships cover a set number of people, not households. We have three levels intended for families of all sizes— Dual, Family, and Premium levels . The Premium is ideal for larger households. If more than two adults and four children (or one adult and five children) will be visiting the museum at once, consider purchasing our Premium membership. What are your donor levels of membership? Free admission is just the beginning—and your gift to the Carnegie Museums makes a difference! Visit our website to learn more about joining the Donors Circle or Patrons Circle or by calling our Donor Services line at 412.622.5772. You can also make a donation here . Why isn’t my discount/promotion code being applied towards my online purchase? If you’re having trouble joining, please call 412.622.3314. On the weekends, please leave a message, and we will call you back on the next business day. If you received an email, you must purchase through the links in the original email message to receive the discount. We cannot retroactively apply discounts. If you have questions, please call us before hitting “Submit.” If you receive a membership promotion from Carnegie Museums,

back on the next business day. If you received an email, you must purchase through the links in the original email message to receive the discount. We cannot retroactively apply discounts. If you have questions, please call us before hitting “Submit.” If you receive a membership promotion from Carnegie Museums, please make sure that the offer has not expired. If the offer is still valid, make sure that you are typing in the web address exactly as found on your offer. I received multiple discount offers from Carnegie Museums. Can I use them all at once? Only one offer or discount can be applied per membership purchase. However, you are more than welcome to select which offer you would like to use. Our individual Senior membership level is already discounted, and cannot be combined with other offers. Will I receive renewal information before my membership expires? Your expiration date is printed on your membership card. If you are opted in to receive communications, you will receive renewal notices at least two months before your membership expires to give you plenty of time to renew. Please contact us about any address or email changes, so that you receive renewal notices. I already renewed. Why am I still receiving notices? Due to processing time, some materials will cross paths in the mail. This should end once you receive your card(s). If it does not, please contact us. General What exhibitions and programs are at the museums? What are the museum hours? For complete information about museum hours and programs, please contact the museum directly: Carnegie Museum of Art (412.622.3131) Carnegie Museum of Natural History (412.622.3131) Kamin Science Center (412.237.3400) The Andy Warhol Museum (412.237.8300) I’m not receiving member emails. Why? If you are not receiving member emails, please contact us. There are various reasons why you may not be receiving member emails, but we’ll make sure to add you to our list. When will I receive my membership cards? You will receive your membership cards within 15 business days of your purchase. If your cards do not arrive within four weeks, please contact us to request new cards. Please include your mailing address so we can verify it when sending the new cards. What if my card is lost, stolen, or has errors? Please contact us to request a new card. If your card is lost or stolen, your membership is still secure. Four Museums. One Membership. Weddings at the Museums - Carnegie Museums of Pittsburgh Plan An Event / Weddings at the Museums Make your wedding day truly distinctive at one of the four Carnegie Museums. IMAGE GALLERY Celebrate your big day in the glorious Carnegie Music Hall Foyer, pose for photographs on the awe-inspiring Grand Staircase, and host your cocktail reception along the balcony above. Or take your wedding to Kamin Science Center along Pittsburgh’s scenic North Shore, where the new PointView Hall will provide stunning views of the Point and Pittsburgh’s three rivers. Or give your guests something to talk about with a reception at the The Andy Warhol Museum. Tell us about your plans and let us get back to you with ideas. Complete an About my Event form . For The Andy Warhol Museum, call 412.237.3431 or email us . Carnegie Museums in Oakland: Wedding Catering Packages Kamin Science Center: Wedding Catering Packages FAQs What all is included in the rental fee? Tables/chairs, custodial services, limited technical services, entrance security, and someone from the special events office to oversee the event. Things that are prohibited: Sparklers indoors/outdoors, bubbles, dropped/tossed flower petals, confetti indoors/outside, open-flame tapered candles, popcorn, balloons, and open flames. Can anything be hung up? In most cases, we ask that nothing be hung on the walls and signage be free-standing. But that depends on the venue. Just tell us what you have in mind. What time does my event have to end? In most cases, we ask that events end by 1 a.m. Let us know if this is a problem for you event. Do you have a preferred catering list? We partner with our exclusive caterer, Culinaire. Can I bring in cookies for a wedding? Yes! We love the Pittsburgh Cookie Table tradition. Are linens included in fees? Yes, they are included in our wedding package (but not in our other events packages). Can I take pictures in Museum galleries? You can absolutely take photographs in all event spaces. Museum gallery photography varies, however. Just ask us. What about storage for my event? All items that come into the museum must leave the same day. Do you have any preferred vendors? You are welcome to contract the florist and/or entertainment of your choice. We are happy to make recommendations, if needed. How does parking work? Our museums have different parking operations, so please contact your event manager, who will be happy to share venue-specific information. Can you suggest additional museum experiences for my guests? Yes! We can provide
